summary: MY 2001 HONDA CIVIC LX LOST SPEED RIGHT ON THE CROWDED FREEWAY.  I MANAGED TO GET OFF THE FREEWAY AND CAME TO THE STOP. THE GEAR WAS NOT ENGAGED AND THE ENGINE CHECK LINE LIT UP.  THE TRANSMISSION FAILED WITHOUT WARNING.  I NOW HAVE LEARNED THAT TRANSMISSION FAILURE IS COMMON ON THIS CAR MODEL BUT THERE IS NO RECALL.  ANY THING THAT NHTSA WOULD DO TO HELP US CONSUMERS WITH THIS ISSUE? *TR
